title: European Social Survey Central Coordination Funds
abstractText:
The European Social Survey (ESS) is a social science research infrastructure with 4 key aims:

  1. To chart and explain long-term changes in Europe's social, political and moral climate.
  2. To spread improved standards of rigour in cross-national social measurement.
  3. To introduce soundly-based attitudinal indicators of national progress, based on citizens' judgements of key aspects of their societies.
  4. To improve the visibility, training and outreach of measurements of social change.

An academically-driven comparative time series, the ESS explores people's value orientations, their political and cultural perspectives and the underlying social structure of their societies. Its funding arrangements and organisational structure have been described as a premature exemplar of the European Research Area at work.

ESRC funding will make a contribution both to the central coordination costs of ESS Round 5, and to the preparation of the ESS's longer-term existence as a European Research Infrastructure Consortium (ERIC). The ESRC has, on behalf of the UK Government, proposed the UK as the host country of the new ERIC - an offer welcomed by all other participating nations. City University London has offered to set up and house the new ERIC.
